fields.name: Spider Plant
fields.description: A member of the Asparagaceae (Asparagus) family, it is a resilient and low-maintenance houseplant native to South Africa. It thrives in moderate sunlight but can tolerate low light conditions, making it a great choice for various indoor settings. Water every 1-2 weeks, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings. Non-toxic to humans and pets, it's a perfect option for families and pet owners.

fields.name: Alocasia
fields.description: A part of the Araceae (Arum) family, it is known for its striking arrow-shaped leaves. It is a tropical plant originating from Southeast Asia. It prefers moderate sunlight and requires consistent, moderate watering, keeping the soil moist but not soggy. Highly toxic to pets and humans if ingested, causing irritation and swelling.

fields.name: Peace Lily
fields.description: A part of the Araceae (Arum) family. It is a graceful plant native to tropical Americas. It grows well in low to moderate light and needs moderate watering, with the soil kept consistently moist but not waterlogged. Mildly toxic to humans and pets, it can cause oral irritation and discomfort if ingested.

fields.name: Snake Plant
fields.description: A member of the Asparagaceae (Asparagus) family. It is also called Mother-in-Law's Tongue, hails from West Africa. It's highly adaptable, thriving in low to bright indirect light, and requires watering only once every 2-3 weeks, allowing the soil to dry completely. It's mildly toxic if ingested, causing gastrointestinal upset in pets and humans.

fields.name: Jade Plant
fields.description: A member of the Crassulaceae family, also known as the stonecrop family. It is native to South Africa and Mozambique. It is a popular succulent with thick, glossy leaves. It thrives in moderate sunlight and requires infrequent watering, every 2-4 weeks, ensuring the soil dries out completely between sessions. Toxic to pets, it can cause vomiting and lethargy if consumed.

fields.name: Pothos
fields.description: A part of the Araceae (Arum) family. It is also known as Devil's Ivy, and is a versatile trailing plant native to the Solomon Islands. It grows well in moderate to low light and requires infrequent watering, about once every 1-2 weeks. Toxic to pets and humans, it can cause irritation and swelling if ingested.

fields.name: Rubber Tree
fields.description: Belonging to the Moraceae family it is a tropical plant from Southeast Asia, loved for its thick, glossy leaves. It thrives in moderate sunlight and needs watering every 1-2 weeks, allowing the top inch of soil to dry out between waterings. Mildly toxic, it can cause digestive upset if ingested by pets or humans.

fields.name: Monstera
fields.description: A part of the Araceae (Arum) family, originating from Central and South America, is a dramatic plant with large, split leaves. It prefers moderate to bright indirect sunlight and moderate watering, letting the topsoil dry between waterings. Its toxicity can cause oral irritation and discomfort if consumed by pets or humans.

fields.name: ZZ Plant
fields.description: A part of the Araceae (Arum) family. It is a hardy and drought-tolerant plant native to East Africa. It grows well in low to moderate light and requires watering only when the soil is completely dry. Mildly toxic, it can cause irritation if ingested by pets or humans.

fields.name: Aloe Vera
fields.description: A member of the Asphodelaceae family. It is well known for its medicinal properties, originates from the Arabian Peninsula. It thrives in moderate sunlight and requires watering only once every 2-3 weeks, allowing the soil to dry out completely. Non-toxic to humans, but toxic to pets if ingested, causing vomiting and lethargy.

fields.name: Calatheas
fields.description: Part of the Marantaceae family and native to South America, it is an ornamental plant with striking, variegated foliage. It prefers low to moderate light and needs regular watering to keep the soil evenly moist. Non-toxic to pets and humans, it's a safe and decorative indoor plant.

fields.name: English Ivy
fields.description: Part of the Araliaceae family, it is a fast-growing trailing plant native to Europe and Western Asia. It thrives in moderate to low light and requires watering every 1-2 weeks, allowing the soil to dry between waterings. Toxic to pets and humans, ingestion can cause gastrointestinal distress and skin irritation.

fields.name: African Violet
fields.description: Part of the Gesneriaceae family it is a charming, compact flowering plant native to Tanzania. It prefers moderate to bright indirect light and consistent, moderate watering with room-temperature water. Non-toxic to humans and pets, it's an ideal choice for indoor decoration.

fields.name: Heartleaf Philodendron
fields.description: A part of the Araceae (Arum) family. It is a trailing vine from Central and South America. It thrives in moderate sunlight and requires watering every 1-2 weeks, ensuring the soil dries partially between waterings. Toxic to pets and humans, it can cause irritation and swelling if ingested.

fields.name: String of Pearls
fields.description: In the Asteraceae (Daisy) family, it is a striking succulent native to Southwest Africa. It requires bright indirect sunlight and infrequent watering, about once every 2-3 weeks. Mildly toxic to pets and humans, it can cause gastrointestinal upset if consumed.

fields.name: Moth Orchid
fields.description: A member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and parts of Australia, is a beautiful and easy-care flowering plant. It thrives in moderate to bright indirect sunlight and needs watering every 1-2 weeks, avoiding waterlogging. Non-toxic to humans and pets, it's safe for any household.

fields.name: Wax Plant
fields.description: Part of the Dogbanes family. It is a fragrant flowering plant with waxy leaves, native to Asia and Australia. It grows best in moderate sunlight and requires low watering, allowing the soil to dry out before the next session. Non-toxic to humans and pets, it's a safe and long-lasting indoor plant.

fields.name: Parlor Palm
fields.description: A member of the Arecaceae family. It is a compact and graceful plant from the rainforests of Central America. It tolerates low light and needs moderate watering, keeping the soil slightly moist. Non-toxic to humans and pets, it's a perfect low-maintenance indoor palm.

fields.name: Croton
fields.description: Part of the Euphorbiaceae family with its vibrant multi-colored leaves, originates from Southeast Asia and the Pacific Islands. It requires high sunlight and moderate watering, keeping the soil evenly moist. Toxic to pets and humans, ingestion can lead to irritation and gastrointestinal discomfort.

fields.name: Fiddle Leaf Fig
fields.description: A part of the Moraceae family it is a trendy plant with large, violin-shaped leaves, native to West Africa. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires moderate watering, letting the topsoil dry out between sessions. Toxic to pets and humans, it can cause irritation and vomiting if ingested.

fields.name: Prayer Plant
fields.description: In the Marantaceae family. It is a tropical plant from Central and South America known for its folding leaves at night. It prefers low to moderate light and needs moderate watering, keeping the soil consistently moist but not soggy. Non-toxic to humans and pets, it's safe for all households.

fields.name: Dumb Cane
fields.description: In the Araceae family. It is a striking plant with patterned leaves, native to the tropics of Central and South America. It thrives in moderate sunlight and requires consistent, moderate watering. Highly toxic to pets and humans, it can cause severe oral irritation and swelling if ingested.

fields.name: Chinese Evergreen
fields.description: A member of the Araceae (Arum) family. It is a hardy plant native to Southeast Asia. It grows well in low to moderate light and needs low watering, letting the soil dry out slightly between sessions. Mildly toxic to pets and humans, ingestion can cause irritation and swelling.

fields.name: Kentia Palm
fields.description: It is in Arecaceae famly and is an elegant palm tree native to Lord Howe Island in Australia. It tolerates low to moderate light and requires moderate watering, allowing the soil to dry out slightly between waterings. Non-toxic to pets and humans, it's a great addition for homes and offices.

fields.name: Cast Iron Plant
fields.description: A member of the Asparagaceae (Asparagus) family, originally from East Asia, it is known for its durability and ability to thrive in low-light conditions. It requires low watering, letting the soil dry out completely between sessions. Non-toxic to pets and humans, it's perfect for beginners or busy plant owners.

fields.name: Corn Plant
fields.description: In the Asparagaceae (Asparagus) family. It is a tall, ornamental plant with variegated leaves, native to tropical Africa. It prefers moderate sunlight and requires moderate watering, ensuring the topsoil dries out before watering again. Mildly toxic to pets and humans, it can cause irritation if ingested.

fields.name: Norfolk Island Pine
fields.description: It is in the Araucariaceae family. It is a miniature evergreen tree native to Norfolk Island in the South Pacific. It thrives in bright indirect sunlight and needs moderate watering, letting the top inch of soil dry between sessions. Mildly toxic, ingestion can cause gastrointestinal distress in pets and humans.

fields.name: Lucky Bamboo
fields.description: In the Asparagaceae (Asparagus) family. It is a versatile plant native to Central Africa, symbolizing good fortune in Feng Shui. It grows well in low to moderate light and needs moderate watering, ensuring the water or soil is kept consistently moist. Mildly toxic, ingestion can cause irritation and upset stomach in pets.

fields.name: Boston Fern
fields.description: It is in the Nephrolepidaceae family. It is native to tropical regions, is a classic fern with arching fronds. It thrives in low to moderate sunlight and requires high humidity with consistent watering to keep the soil moist. Non-toxic, it's a safe choice for homes with pets and children.

fields.name: Pepperomia
fields.description: Within in the Piperaceae (Peppercorn) family, a compact plant native to South America, is loved for its thick, glossy leaves and ease of care. It thrives in low to moderate light and requires low watering, letting the soil dry between sessions. Non-toxic to pets and humans, it's a safe and stylish choice for any home.
